He added: Don't get me wrong, he's still my boss, but he's sort of a Victorian father- you'd hate to let him down. On the occasion that happens I literally feel sick. Kirsten Gillibrand 's decision sends a positive message. ''I think it's an affirmation about Rensselaer County-- that it's a great place to live, work and raise a family,'' Jimino said. It will mean she has first-hand knowledge of how decisions that are made in Washington are affecting business, government and education in upstate. ''I think she feels strongly about the tie to Troy, Jimino said. ''She has talked at Emma Willard . She was at Sage in the fall for her debate and made contact with several students. ''It strains credulity to expect anyone to believe that the position of the British government wasn't well known by those who granted Al-Megrahi his so-called compassionate release,'' said Sen. Chuck Schumer ( D-N.Y.). This report confirms what many of us have long suspected: the British government and BP wanted Al-Megrahi released so that an oil deal being negotiated with Libya could go forward. Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand said the findings only heighten her worry that Megrahi's release undermines the international struggle against terrorism.
